entry.title: An XML output is triggered parallel even if I change the output channel before updating a changed PO
entry.content:
On the supplier under collaboration communication you would not see a standard XML output.

Regardless of that if you maintain XML manually  and save, xml would be selectable.

What happens in the below scenario.

 

Created PO would be send out via XML which is correct and wanted.

for any changed PO your customer do not want to receive any updates. Therefore before send an update to the supplier you change the output in the edit output settings to , do not send, printing, email.

The output would show that the changed PO was sent to the printer but parallel still an xml output is triggered.

This is the expected system behaviour as you bypassing the SAP Standard output.

entry.title: Professional service Projects
entry.content:
Hi,

Our customer is running S4 public cloud and is a professional service company with a lot of professional services projects serving a lot of customers. Those projects has during the implementation project been created as periodic services, however now when we've been understanding more of their business we start to discuss if they should for the future create projects with fixed price instead. However when searching for this we can't really find any clear explanation of which should be used when. Does any body have any real example of how those two types should be used typically? 

We know that based of the contract type we've got a revenue recognition key and that the different contract types consists of different ways of calculating the revenue. 

Kind regards, Sanne

entry.title: Re: BOB - The Business Objects Board
entry.content: The BusinessObjects Board, or BOB, is alive and well, moving to a new platform and domain in the cloud in September 2020. Speak BO is another free community for SAP BusinessObjects users, although it has some paid features that unlock additional content.

entry.title: Re: Proxy operation in BAS
entry.content: The proxy configuration is meant for local testing in BAS and you need to configure the application with an appropriate destination that is referenced in the xs-app.json file.

entry.title: Re: Posting credit memo: Acquisition value will become ne...
entry.content:
HI @Yaya_AB ,

Below are few options to troubleshoot your issue.

AreaDescriptionReason Error Happens (Even for 1 EUR)How to DiagnoseRecommended Solution
Fully depreciated assetAsset‚Äôs depreciation = APCCredit memo would make APC < depreciation ‚Üí negative APCCheck APC, cumulative dep., NBV in Display Asset ValuesPost retirement instead of credit memo or reverse excess depreciation (write-up)
Very low Net Book ValueNBV close to zeroEven small credit pushes NBV negativeReview NBV in Asset ValuesPost retirement or adjust depreciation
Revaluations / impairmentsAPC layers recalculatedOne layer is already at zero ‚Üí credit makes it negativeUse Asset Values ‚Äì Posting View to inspect APC layersUse APC correction posting to adjust layers
Prior partial retirementQuantity or APC already reducedFurther APC reduction violates quantity/APC controlCheck asset history in Asset History Sheet (F1606)Post additional retirement, not credit memo
Depreciation key restrictionsCertain keys block negative base valuesKey does not allow reductions beyond current APCCheck depreciation key in configurationChange useful life, or perform write-up
Useful life expiredRemaining useful life = 0System prevents APC reductions after end of useful lifeCheck useful life in Asset Master ‚Üí Time Dependent DataExtend useful life
Over-depreciationDepreciation posted > APCFurther APC reduction becomes impossibleCompare APC vs cumulative depreciationPost write-up to correct depreciation
Parallel depreciation areasOne area has APC at zeroCredit memo fails across all areasCheck area values in Asset Values ‚Äì Posting ViewAdjust area-specific APC using correction posting
Strict Cloud Edition logicCloud prevents negative APC at any layerValidation stronger than On-PremiseN/A (standard behavior)Use APC correction, or retirement instead of credit memo

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Warranty Claim Form (FDP_WARRANTY_CLAIM_E) Issues in SAP S/4HANA Public Edition
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We‚Äôve been working with the FDP_WARRANTY_CLAIM_E form template in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, and we‚Äôve encountered several issues that I‚Äôd like to check if others have also experienced.

  1. Data Source Connection:
    Initially, the form would not open properly in Adobe LiveCycle Designer due to a missing XML Schema (‚ÄúRoot element named ‚Äòdata‚Äô could not be found‚Äù). We had to manually reconnect the XSD data source in Adobe to make it work. After that, the form started loading normally.

  2. Master Form Issue:
    I already associate the custom form with a custom master form in CBC, but the Warranty Claim form does not take any master form at all. It doesn‚Äôt use our custom master (which includes our company logo and layout) nor the typical SAP master with the tree logo used by other forms. Instead, it renders with a completely different layout showing a blue SAP logo, as if it contains its own internal master page.

  3. Missing or Empty Fields:
    The form contains very few data fields, and several important ones are empty in the runtime data, especially:

    • Supplier / Business Partner

    • Supplier Address and Contact fields

    These elements are defined in the XSD but come through empty in the form‚Äôs XML data.

üëâ Has anyone else faced this same issue with the Warranty Claim Form (FDP_WARRANTY_CLAIM_E) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
Were you able to make it use the correct master form and populate the supplier details?

Any guidance or confirmation from others who have worked with this form would be greatly appreciated.

I also haven‚Äôt found any way to extend the data source or add custom logic associated with this form to enhance its structure.

Thanks in advance!
Diego

entry.title: Re: How to work with exemptions using ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC) in the cloud during development in an
entry.content:
Hi @OlgaDolinskaja ,

We have configured the central ATC checks with the BTP ABAP Environment for the on-premises S/4 Foundation 2023-based system. I can execute central ATC checks from Eclipse, and I can also see the exemption requests in the 'Approve ATC Exemptions' Fiori app in the BTP ABAP Environment. The only problem I am facing now is that the approved exemptions are not being considered in the subsequent ATC runs, and the same approved finding is reported again. I can request exemptions as many times as I want for the same finding with the same checksum. There are no auth or RFC failures.
What might be wrong here?

Regards,
Rishi

entry.title: Data Space Integration Package
entry.content:
Exciting News: Introducing the new data space integration package!

We are pleased to announce the successful release of our new add-on SKU: data space integration package! Officially available on the price list as of October 20th, this milestone reflects our commitment to advancing data space adoption and delivering greater value to our customers.

What does it include?

The data space integration package is designed to enable organizations to securely and efficiently connect supply chain partners within data spaces so that they can exchange data in a secure and sovereign way ‚Äì a key requirement for modern digital supply chains. It contains two powerful components:

  • data space integration, a connector that facilitates smooth, secure and self-sovereign data exchange in data spaces.
  • decentralized identity verification, a wallet that allows businesses to efficiently share trustworthy, verifiable data.

Highlights:

  • Key application areas: Manufacturing-X, Catena-X, Factory-X, Semiconductor-X, Chem-X and supply chain networks in other data spaces.
  • Competitive Pricing: The pricing has been carefully structured to ensure competitiveness, while maintaining SAP‚Äôs high standard of quality. This is initially available exclusively as a single add-on to the Integration Suite Starter Edition, with planned expansion to multi-connector support for all Integration Suite editions starting Q2 2026 (based on our product roadmap).
  • Benefits: The package facilitates data-driven collaboration to optimize production, enhance supply chain visibility and drive innovation, and promotes interoperability amongst partner applications.

Why Is This Important?

The Data Space Integration Package represents SAP‚Äôs ongoing dedication to simplifying data collaboration and helping customers unlock new business models. With global supply chains growing more complex, establishing secure, sovereign, and verifiable data exchange is more critical than ever.

Looking Ahead

We are excited to see how our customers leverage the data space integration package to streamline data exchange and reshape secure collaboration across their partner networks.

For more information about pricing and availability, or to learn how you can get started, contact us.

Stay tuned for more updates on SAP Integration Suite‚Äôs data space capabilities!

entry.title: Where can I learn how to use SAP BTP for architecture design and IT strategy alignment?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Becoming an SAP BTP Solution Architect  learning journey.

Upon completing this learning journey, you will have a comprehensive understanding of the tools and methods required to effectively use SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) to envision and design an enterprise architecture. In your role as a solution architect, you will be equipped with the skills to align IT strategies with business objectives using SAP BTP tools and technologies. Additionally, you will gain the ability to estimate the costs of various use-cases, ensuring that your solutions are both effective and cost-efficient.

 


Goals
  • Get started with SAP: Building the basics
  • Develop your expertise: Skill deepening learning
  • Excel in your expertise: Advanced specialization learning

Prerequisites

  • Exploring SAP Business Technology Platform
 

Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 

Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! 
We are here to support you.


I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Re: Material Ledger master data cannot be created for val...
entry.content:
Hi Laxman,
To resolve this issue, follow these steps to ensure all prerequisites are met.

Checklist to Fix FINS_ML_START020
1. Ensure Valuation Area is Assigned to a Company Code Go to transaction OMWB and verify that the valuation area is correctly assigned to a company code.
2. Activate Material Ledger in Customizing Use transaction OMX1 to activate the Material Ledger for the valuation area. Also check OMX2 and OMX3 for currency settings and ledger types.
3.Set Valuation Area as Productive After activation, use CKMSTART to set the valuation area as productive. If this fails, it may be due to missing configuration or open transports.
4. Check for Open Transports or Locks If the company code or valuation area is locked due to open transports (e.g., Q to P), ML activation may be blocked. Refer to SAP Note 2831274 for guidance.
5. Run Production Startup Utilities In some cases, you need to run Production Startup via: Accounting ‚Üí Controlling ‚Üí Actual Costing/Material Ledger ‚Üí Utilities ‚Üí Production Startup This converts material data for ML use.
6.Review SAP Notes for System Conversion Scenarios If you're migrating from ECC or Simple Finance to S/4HANA, follow SAP Note 2352383 for proper ML activation steps.


Use transaction CKM3N to verify if any materials are already using ML. Check material master settings in MM01/MM02 to ensure ML-relevant views are maintained. Ensure currency types are correctly configured for ML in OMX2.

Hope above this will resolve your issue

entry.title: Need CDS View for Ocean Freight Booking Details and Reporting ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We are working in SAP Public Cloud Grow Edition and have created freight bookings in the Manage Ocean Freight Booking application.

Now we want to retrieve booking details (i.e., Port of Loading, discharge, Vessel, Voyage and other related fields) for implementing further business solutions, but we are unable to find any released CDS view which can be utilized for the same.

Please guide us by providing the released CDS view from which this information can be retrieved.

We also need CDS views to create queries for reporting purposes, as the current queries are deprecated.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Need CDS View for Ocean Freight Booking Details and R...
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

  • Retrieving Freight Booking Details (Vessel, Voyage, Port of Loading, etc.)

The necessary booking details are available across the following released CDS Views, which are classified as C1 released (suitable for consumption and custom logic implementation):

  • For Vessel and Voyage: Please utilize the CDS View I_TransportationOrderStage_2.

  • For Port of Loading and Discharge: Please utilize the CDS View I_TransportationOrderStop_2.

As these views are C1 released, you can use them internally within your S/4HANA Cloud environment for implementing further business solutions via Key User Extensibility.

Alternative for External Consumption

If you require this data for external consumption, you can utilize the available Freight Booking API:

Freight Booking API Documentation

  • CDS Views for Reporting Purposes

The same released CDS Views mentioned above (I_TransportationOrderStage_2 and I_TransportationOrderStop_2) are suitable for creating custom analytical queries for reporting purposes, replacing any deprecated queries you may be currently using.

We hope this guidance helps you proceed with your implementations. Please let us know if you have any further questions.

Best regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Content Security Policy: when SAP S/4HANA cares like a mother
entry.content:
Disclaimer: I was made aware of the fact that "don't talk to strangers" is actually not very good advice when it comes to safety of children. Reason:  such advice might prevent kids from seeking help from unknown adults. And situations where seeking help from random strangers is beneficial are more common than cases where talking to strangers is dangerous.

So to avoid any misunderstandings: this blog post is trying to give advice on CSPs, not on child safety. I just needed an attention-grabbing introduction.

entry.title: How to create a Worker via SOAP API in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Pre-requisite:

The Communication Arrangement for the scenario External HR Workforce Integration (SAP_COM_0301), needs to be setup in the Target System.

  1. Create a communication user using the Maintain Communication Users app.
    To create a New Communication User follow the below steps
    1. Go to the New button.

       

    2. Create the New Communication User (For Example I have taken the name ‚ÄúSOAP_API_0301‚Äù. Once you have filled in the required details

       

    3. Create it.
      2. Create a communication system using the Communication Systems app. For more information, refer to Maintain Communication Systems.
      1. Go to the app Communication Systems.
      2. Try to create a new Communication System and fill in the data in the fields (System Id, System Name and the Host name).

        For example: I have taken my Target system as CCF/708. The Host name will be ‚Äúccf-708.devsys.net.sap‚Äù.

         

      3. Now go to the Tab ‚ÄúUsers for Inbound Communication‚Äù and add the newly created Communication User.
      4. The Authentication Method needs to be ‚ÄúUserName and Password‚Äù.
      5. Then Click on ‚ÄúOK‚Äù.
      6. Then Click on ‚ÄúSave‚Äù it.

         

3. Create a communication arrangement using the Communication Arrangement app (SAP_COM_0301).

  1. To create the Communication Arrangement, go to the App ‚ÄúCommunication Arrangement‚Äù.
  2. Click on New.
  3. Put the scenario id SAP_COM_0301.
  4. Click on Create button.
  5. Maintain the New created Communication System (Example: SOAP_API_0301).
  6. Once you maintain the Communication System, the Inbound communication will be automatically populated based on the configuration before.
  7. Then Save it.

Steps to perform to the Worker Creation:

  1. Once the Communication Arrangement is setup correctly in the Target System, we are going to use Bruno to try to push the Payload and create the Worker.
  2. In Bruno, we will create a collection with the required name and the location. (For Example, we are using the collection CC3_708).

     

  3. Once that is done try Creating a New Request on the New Collection.
  4. In creation of the request, put in the Request Name (For Example: Creation of the Worker) with the Type ‚ÄúHTTP‚Äù.
  5. In the URL, the request should be the POST.

     

  6. The Request URL needs to be taken from the Target System from the app ‚ÄúCommunication Arrangement‚Äù from the Inbound Services with the application protocol ‚ÄúSOAP‚Äù.

     

  7. Copy the URL and paste it in here.

     

  8. Then create it.
  9. Once the request is created in the Bruno, it will be showing up like the below screenshot.
  10. Navigate to the Body Tab set the type to be XML.
  11. Then put in the required XML Payload.
  12. Then Navigate to the Tab Header.

     

  13. Add Header with the below values
    Key: Content-Type
    Value: text/xml
  14. Once that is maintained, navigate to the ‚ÄúAuth‚Äù Tab. Change it to Basic Auth from Inherit.

     

  15. Once that is set up you need to take up username and password maintained in the app Communication Arrangement in the Inbound Communication part.
  16. Copy the authentication details (username and password) to the Auth section in Bruno.
  17. Then Save the request and execute it.
  18. Once that is executed correctly, it will show the status 200 OK.
  19. Then check for the Worker with the provided worker id/ Person UUID in the app ‚ÄúManage Workforce‚Äù app.
  20. Now the Worker is created with provided details in the XML and with the Entry Source SOAP API(A).

For any further Information refer to the help documentation below,
Replicate Basic Master Data for Workforce from External HR Systems | SAP Help Portal.

entry.title: Re: ALV Background spool open as Excel file
entry.content:
It's not possible to send an Excel attachment via spool list recipient in SM37.

You may send only the formats specified in SCOT > Options > SMTP connections > Outbound > SMTP Node > Internet > Double click to see the options.

They are also described here: Formats | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Re: ALV Background spool open as Excel file
entry.content:
Hello Geoff,

You can use class CL_SALV_BS_RUNTIME_INFO to get the AlV report contents in an internal table and download it as an excel or send as an email attachment without needing to send the report to spool. 
https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-blog-posts/gain-programmatic-access-to-data-of-sapgui-alv-reports/ba-p/12945057

Best Regards,

Siva

entry.title: Re: SAP Service Cloud - Exporting Internal Notes
entry.content:
Hello BusraKulahci,

*****See the comments section. You can pass the service ticket id directly to the Service Request Notes object in the DWB tool. So you don't need to perform some of the steps below to fetch the ticket object id.***** 

You can get this done using the DWB tool. To achieve this you will first need to get the tickets object id by exporting the tickets. Once you have the object ID of the ticket, you pass that as the parent object id for the service notes object.

For example, here is a ticket that has 2 notes.

Take the ticket id 1913636 and get its object id from the Service Request object. 

Then take the object id 0AB6C4C4B4871FE096E812F3BEFE95AB and put it in the parent object id field of the Service Request Notes object 

That will fetch you the notes associated with this ticket.

Julius

entry.title: SAP Datasphere ‚Äì Existing Connections Suddenly Stopped Working After Cloud Connector Upgrade
entry.content:
Good day,

I hope someone can help me with the following issue.

In my company we use SAP Datasphere, and we already had three connections created. These connections had been working perfectly for a long time, and I was able to create Replication Flows and other objects consuming data from our source system (SAP S/4HANA).

However, two days ago all three connections suddenly stopped working. They are no longer usable, as shown in Image (1), where you can see the same error displayed for all three connections.

Our Basis support team tried upgrading the Cloud Connector to the latest available version, as shown in Image (2), but unfortunately this did not solve the issue.

We would appreciate any guidance or suggestions to help us resolve this problem.

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Re: Move SU with multiple item problem
entry.content:
A total of six enhancements must be implemented in the main program SAPML03T in order to pass the determined values to the main program SAPLL03B.

Includes to Enhance (implizit):

- ML03TFHU_LENUM_EINL_CHECK
- ML03TF20_T333_LESEN
- ML03TFBM_LEQUANTS_INT_LTAP
- ML03TF20_T340D_LESEN
- MLLVSFOR - FORM T340_LESEN
- ML03TF50_DATEN_LTAP_MLVS

Example in ML03TFBM_LEQUANTS_INT_LTAP:

* QUANTO Sebastian Wachter 06.11.2025 Daten korrekt anderem Rahmenprogramm bei externem Aufruf √ºbergeben
FIELD-SYMBOLS <INT_LTAP> TYPE ANY TABLE.
ASSIGN ('(SAPLL03B)INT_LTAP[]') TO <INT_LTAP>.
IF <INT_LTAP> IS ASSIGNED.
IF <INT_LTAP>[] IS INITIAL.
<INT_LTAP>[] = INT_LTAP[].
ENDIF.
ENDIF.

Example in ML03TF20_T333_LESEN:
* QS S.Wachter 06.11.2025 In anderem Rahmenprogramm Daten korrekt setzen
FIELD-SYMBOLS <t333> TYPE any.
ASSIGN ('(SAPLL03B)T333') TO <t333>.
IF <t333> IS ASSIGNED.
IF <t333> IS INITIAL.
<t333> = t333.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.

entry.title: Issue in SAP MDK Data Table Control ‚Äì setValue() Not Working

I am working on the SAP MDK Data Table control, where I need to set the value of one column based on the user-entered value in another column. The edit mode is set to Inline.

On the Save button, I have added the following rule to set the status:

let currentCell = context.getPageProxy().getControl('SectionedTable0').getSection('SectionDataTable0').getCell(0, 0);
const newValue = "Accepted";
currentCell.setValue(newValue);


I have referred to the following blog, but this approach doesn‚Äôt seem to work. I would appreciate any help or suggestions on this issue.

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/what-s-new-in-mobile-development-kit-client-23-4/ba-p/13557735

 

I also tried the below code snippet, but it did not work either:

let currentCell = context.getControl('SectionedTable0').getSection('SectionDataTable0').getCell(0, 0);
const newValue = "My Product";
currentCell.setValue(newValue);

 


Thank you in advance for your help!
@bill_froelich 
@Jitendra_Kansal78

In standard, for the timesheet to be submitted on PPM tasks, we need to assign/plan resources on the roles against the task and then it appears in the worklist of CAT2 from where you can book the hours. 
 
However,  We have many resources which can't be planned on PPM projects in advance. This unplanned resources will still need to book hours on tasks.

Neither we are able to add task manually in the assignment in the app.

Appreciate your help!

entry.title: OData Service FAA_ASSET_OVERVIEWPAGE (Entity Set C_AssetBalanceOverviewResult)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

When trying to fetch data from the entity set C_AssetBalanceOverviewResult of the OData service FAA_ASSET_OVERVIEWPAGE, I encountered an issue related to the input parameters.

The service metadata for C_AssetBalanceOverviewParameters exposes the following parameters:
P_CompanyCode
P_CurrencyRole
P_FiscalPeriod
P_FiscalYear
P_Ledger
However, in the underlying CDS Data Definition C_AssetBalanceOverview, I see additional parameters:
define view C_AssetBalanceOverview
with parameters
P_TodayDate : fagl_keydate,
P_AssetAccountingKeyFigureSet : faa_key_figure_set,
P_CompanyCode : fis_bukrs,
P_Ledger : fis_rldnr,
P_FiscalYear : fis_ryear,
P_FiscalPeriod : fis_poper,
P_CurrencyRole : fis_curtp,
P_FiscalPeriodEndDate : fagl_keydate (derived automatically)

The parameters P_TodayDate and P_AssetAccountingKeyFigureSet are marked with @Consumption.hidden, so they are not visible in the OData metadata.

When I call the OData service and provide only the visible parameters:
P_CompanyCode
P_CurrencyRole
P_FiscalPeriod
P_FiscalYear
P_Ledger
I receive a short dump: CX_SADL_DUMP_APPL_MODEL_ERROR in object FAA_ASSET_OVERVIEWPAGE.

Question:

  1. Are the parameters being passed correctly according to the design of this CDS consumption view and OData service?

  2. How should the hidden parameters (P_TodayDate and P_AssetAccountingKeyFigureSet) be handled when calling the OData service?

  3. Is there a known workaround or recommended approach to avoid the CX_SADL_DUMP_APPL_MODEL_ERROR for this scenario?

Any guidance or reference documentation would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: How to Create a Tile Pointing to dynamic URL : S/4Hana
entry.content:
Hello @Jocelyn_Dart  

We have a similar requirement where we would like to create Tiles in S/4 Fiori Launchpad (2023 Private Cloud) for custom CAP apps deployed in BTP. 

I did the below steps:

  1. SM59 --> Defined new RFC type G "TEST_BTP2FLP_G" pointing to host of BTP 
  2. SM30 -> /UI2/V_SYSALIAS --> Defined new Sys Alias "TEST_BTP" 
  3. SM30 -> /UI2/V_ALIASMAP --> Defined new Alias mapping using Source = "TEST_BTP" and Target = "TEST_BTP2FLP"
  4. /IWFND/ROUTING -> added entry using System Alias = "TEST_BTP2FLP" and RFC destination = "TEST_BTP2FLP_G" 
  5. Created target mapping with fixed part of URL and Alias = "TEST_BTP"
  6. Create Tile for the sem obj and action defined in step 5

When opening the Tile, it goes to a URL constructed as <S/4_HOST>/FIXED_URL instead of going to <BTP_HOST>/FIXED_URL. 

Do you have any documentation on how should we do this kind of integration? Customer would like to have a single entry point for all the apps. 

Thank you!

Lucian

entry.title: Impact of rfc/callback_security_method Setting on Optimizer Functionality
entry.content:
We are experiencing issues with the parameter rfc/callback_security_method currently set to 3 in our SAP RISE environment.
Problem:

When the parameter is set to 3, the RCC_VERSION transaction and RCCF TM Optimizer do not work as expected.
The system generates an ABAP short dump with error:
CALLBACK_REJECTED_BY_WHITELIST
RFC callback call rejected by positive list

This prevents optimizer functionality, which is critical for planning and execution processes.

  1. What is the best way to resolve this issue while keeping the system secure?
    • Should we configure the whitelist for required RFC callbacks?
    • Or is it acceptable to temporarily change the parameter value from 3 to 1?

2. What is the impact if we maintain the parameter value as 1?

  • Are there any major security risks beyond allowing RFC callbacks?
  • Will this affect other components or system stability?

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Impact of rfc/callback_security_method Setting on Opt...
entry.content:
Hello,

The recommendation is to set the rfc/callback_security_method parameter to 3 and adjust the allowlist per the CALLBACK_REJECTED_BY_WHITELIST dumps that are going to be generated.

The only impact the parameter has is on the RFC callback handling. You can read more about this on KBA 3349924 - Impacts of the parameter rfc/callback_security_method.

 

Best regards.

entry.title: Re: Manual Switch off of the distribution of manual accru...
entry.content:
Hi @HariBoyapati2 , 

To introduce more flexibility into your process, you could create two separate Settlement Document Types, one with distribution enabled and one without distribution, both linked to the same Settlement Process Type. This setup will not only give you better control over how settlements are processed but will also make it easier to analyze and report by document type.

Then, during manual settlement creation, you can simply select the appropriate document type based on whether distribution is needed for that scenario.

Also, depending on your use case, you may need to configure or adjust the ‚ÄúEntry Type for Manual Settlement‚Äù (MAN_SETTL_ENTRY_TYPE) in the Condition Contract Settlement Settings to ensure the system behavior aligns with your expected process flow.

Regards, 
Gauthier VICTOR

entry.title: Effortless SAPUI5 Patch Management: Introducing the New SAPUI5 Runtime Repository
entry.content:
For years, the MIME repository has been the standard location for storing SAPUI5 runtime artifacts for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. In contrast, the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition retrieves SAPUI5 from the cloud CDN. Although the MIME repository has served its purpose, many customers working with SAPUI5, especially system operators installing new SAPUI5 patches, face common challenges. These include poor performance, numerous manual steps, issues with transports, and risk of inconsistent states.

The good news is that SAP introduces the SAPUI5 Runtime Repository with the release of SAP S/4HANA 2025. This modern replacement overcomes these challenges and prepares you for the next generation of SAPUI5. To ensure efficiency for all customers, downports to all maintained lower releases are available, except for SAP S/4HANA 1809 using SAPUI5 1.38. You can access this repository through SAP Notes containing transport-based correction instructions (TCIs).

Let's explore how this new repository significantly enhances your workflow.

Performance Where It Matters

  • MIME Repository: SAPUI5 patch updates can take up to 2 hours. Loading debug-sources with sap-ui-debug=true can take up to 10 minutes.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Patch upgrades are approximately 20 times faster. During runtime, loading debug sources also occurs about 20 times faster. These improvements ensure smoother operations and faster response times.

From Complexity to Simplicity

  • MIME Repository: Handles more than 70,000 individual ABAP objects. This volume poses a risk of errors and inconsistent updates.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: All runtime content is bundled into just one ABAP object. This approach guarantees consistent updates and reduces operational risks.

Automation First

  • MIME Repository: Updates rely on custom, manual procedures, which increases the maintenance effort.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Uses SAP TCI Notes and comes with an automated process specifically for SAP S/4HANA cloud operations. This makes updates easier and more reliable.

Zero Downtime Deployments

  • MIME Repository: No support for zero-downtime deployments. This limitation might cause interruptions during system upgrades.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Fully supports online deployment with zero downtime. This feature ensures that SAPUI5 content remains continuously available, even during system upgrades.

Safe, Standardized Rollbacks

  • MIME Repository: Reverting patches can be error-prone, often requiring manual fixes and risking inconsistent system states.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Reverting SAPUI5 patches is fully supported. Runtime content is delivered as a single ABAP object, and the update process integrates with TCIs. Rollbacks are straightforward, consistent, and safe. This approach simplifies the validation of new patches: if issues arise, you can reliably revert to the previous stable state without lengthy manual intervention or risking inconsistencies across systems.

Future-Proof 

  • MIME Repository: Not compatible with multiple SAPUI5 versions.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Supports multiple SAPUI5 versions in parallel, making it ready for the future while ensuring backward compatibility.

Here's an overview of all the improvements:

Why This Matters

The move from MIME Repository to the new SAPUI5 Runtime Repository isn‚Äôt just a technical upgrade ‚Äî it‚Äôs a significant step toward:

  • Faster and safer patch updates.
  • Reduced operational effort.
  • Continuous availability.
  • Future compatibility.

If your organization uses on-premise landscapes and works with SAPUI5, it's time to embrace this change: the SAPUI5 Runtime Repository becomes automatically available with the current SAP S/4HANA 2025 release and in the latest support packages of all maintained SAP S/4HANA versions except SAP S/4HANA 1809.

Even if you do not want to upgrade to a new support package, you can still use the SAPUI5 runtime repository by installing SAP Note 3599156. If you have hesitated to install a new SAPUI5 patch, now is the time to try the new procedure and benefit from its efficacy and ease. Installing the latest SAPUI5 patches ensures your applications run efficiently today and are prepared for the future.

üëâHave you performed any SAPUI5 patch upgrades recently? What has your experience been like so far? To get started, refer to SAP Note 3599156.

entry.title: Re: Managing Compliance Register in SAP EHS: Boosting Transparency and Control
entry.content:
Hi @Hanish_ESG , 
Yes, it is applicable to all three obligation types Regulation, Permit, and Policy available in SAP EHS. However, please note that the applicable requirements will only consider the Level 1 requirement. Sub-level details such as paragraphs, appendices, citations, guidelines, or further Level 2 and below requirements will not be considered in this applicability logic.

entry.title: How AI is Transforming Your Digital Workspace
entry.content:
How AI is Transforming Your Digital Workspace

Introduction

The modern workplace has changed dramatically. Employees no longer rely solely on static intranets or scattered collaboration tools. Instead, they expect a connected, personalized experience that helps them cut through the noise and focus on meaningful work. Enter artificial intelligence (AI).

AI isn‚Äôt just another layer of technology- it‚Äôs rapidly becoming the backbone of digital workspaces. By surfacing the right information at the right time, automating repetitive tasks, and enabling smarter collaboration and self-service, AI is redefining how we work, learn, and engage every day.

With digital workspaces in SAP Build, these AI capabilities are already available today‚Äîhelping organizations deliver intelligent, personalized employee experiences out of the box

The Rise of AI in the Digital Workspace

For years, digital workspaces have been a central hub for business applications, documents, apps, and communications in one place. Useful‚Äîbut often overwhelming. Employees spent as much time searching for information as they did, acting on it.

Now, AI is filling the gaps. With intelligent copilots, content curation, and contextual answers, digital workspaces like SAP Build Work Zone have evolved from being a destination for information into an engine for productivity and engagement.

Core AI features available today in SAP Build digital workspaces

1. Chatbots & Virtual Assistants
With Joule, SAP‚Äôs AI copilot, workspace users can access information instantly. From answering HR questions to surfacing insights from reports, employees can rely on conversational AI to get what they need instantaneously.

Joule, SAP's AI copilot integrated into the digital workspace

2. Task completion with Joule Skills

One can enhance Joule capabilities by creating skills for it in Joule Studio. Connected with SAP systems and third-party applications, Joule can complete tasks like submitting time-off requests, approving workflows, or surfacing KPI dashboards‚Äîall from a single interface

  

3. Document Grounding Capabilities
Joule ensures information is both contextual and reliable when using workspace content to ground AI responses. For example, employees can ask ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs our travel policy in Europe?‚Äù and receive an AI response sourced directly from workspace content or SAP SuccessFactors policies when it is enabled as an AI source.

  

4. Content generation and summarization using generative AI
SAP Build leverages generative AI to help users create and refine content‚Äîwhether drafting announcements, summarizing updates, or suggesting language for a blog post‚Äîdirectly within the workspace.

  

 

 

 

 

Real-Life Examples in Action

  • Information access with grounded responses

Joule responds with answers grounded in the specific workspace content. Employees can query Joule with specific questions like ‚ÄúWhat is the holiday plan for next year in Germany" or ‚Äúhow can I apply for a sabbatical leave? Point me to the relevant file‚Äù.

  • Smart document summaries

Integrated AI services capture the highlights of a workspace document‚Äîpolicy highlights, key insights from data, or high-level overview of a blog.

  • Workflow Automation

From within SAP Build workspace, an employee can ask Joule to ‚Äúcreate a purchase order‚Äù or ‚Äúshow current pipeline metrics.‚Äù The copilot triggers the workflow in connected SAP systems, making productivity seamless.

  • Intelligent content curation

Users can easily create blog posts, feed posts or even knowledge articles in the workspace using the native AI features with simple prompts like ‚Äúcreate a workspace feed reminding members to fill their timesheet in a funny and casual tone‚Äù.

The Business Impact

  • Faster Information Access: Joule makes information searches 95% faster by surfacing insights and data instantly. Grounded insights reduce time spent searching for answers.
  • Reduced Manual Effort: Generative AI-assisted summarization and content creation free up employee time.
  • Better Governance: AI responses in SAP are backed by enterprise content, ensuring compliance and accuracy.

Preparing for the AI-Powered Workspace

Adopting AI in digital workspaces is not just about flipping a switch‚Äîit‚Äôs about preparing your organization:

  • Change Management: Train employees to adopt AI workflows and copilots in their daily work.
  • Governance: Define guardrails for AI-generated content, data privacy, and security.
  • Integration: Maximize value by connecting SAP Build with existing SAP and non-SAP applications, making copilots more powerful.

Conclusion

AI is no longer a future trend; it‚Äôs already embedded in the digital workspaces employees use today. With embedded AI and Joule, organizations don‚Äôt just imagine an intelligent workspace‚Äîthey experience it

By weaving AI into daily workflows‚Äîwhether through copilots, recommended learning, or curated content‚ÄîSAP Build helps organizations unlock productivity, agility, and engagement at scale.

Ready to take the next step?

Learn more about these capabilities and their implementation from the following resources:

  1. Joule integration with Work Zone
  2. SAP Build Work Zone Gets Even More Powerful with AI-Powered Capabilities
  3. Set Up Document Grounding | SAP Help Portal
  4. Integration With Document Grounding | SAP Help Portal
  5. Enabling AI Features | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Plan for migration of interfaces to SAP Cloud Integration(Int. Suite)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are in to aumotive industry,, This is regarding our ongoing plan to replace all the existing PO/PI instances with the shared SAP Cloud Integration(Int. Suite). As you know, we currently have Team A, Team B, Team C, , each using their own SAP PO/PI system, SAP backends, and individual integration teams. Say for example team A --> Financial;; team B --> Supply chain & Logistics ;; team C --> procurement ;;   Also each team has its distinct partner system or common partner system &  common plants between each two teams.  I have the following questions in terms of better architecture, implementation, design, stability, future proof, and operations etc.,

(i) Would it be beneficial for each team to migrate their ICOs to their own Pipeline concept iFlows.

(ii) Should we migrate interfaces system by system (or) plant by plant in a phased manner.

(iii) Standardization and Consistency, Operational Efficiency, Resource Management and Faster Migration (Long-Term), better integration patterns and reducing the complexity etc.

Regards,

Ramu.

entry.title: Re: [SAP Build Process Automation] Desktop Agent does not synchronize deployed projects and stuck lo
entry.content:
Hi JSalas,

Not sure, if I misunderstood your requirement. Here you are trying to run a bot with Automation launcher. In that case your agent should be in Attended mode. If you want to run your both with scheduled trigger or API trigger, it is then you should keep your agent in Unattended mode. Please let me know, if that helps.

 

Thank you

Johnson

entry.title: Re: [SAP Build Process Automation] Desktop Agent does not...
entry.content: Please check and see if the above comment is applicable for you as well. Automation launcher ---> Unattended automation (Agent in attended mode). Scheduled Trigger/ API Trigger--> Unattended automation (agent in unattended mode)

entry.title: Re: Depreciation Keys - Reducing Balance Method
entry.content:
HI @SamadDandiya 

Below table explains the issue with potential approach to solution.

Requirement / IssueECC BehaviorS/4HANA Public Cloud LimitationPublic Cloud Compliant SolutionHow to Configure (Expert Configuration)
Use of custom reducing-balance percentages (e.g., 33.33%, 26.7%, 13.33%)Maintained in Multi-Level MethodCannot create new multi-level methodsCreate new depreciation keys and maintain percentages directlyIn ‚ÄúDefine Depreciation Key‚Äù, enter DB rate (e.g., 33.33%) in Rate field
Multiple rates over different life periodsMulti-level method supports multi-layer %Cloud does not allow new multi-level layersUse Phase Control inside depreciation keyCreate Phase 1, Phase 2, Phase 3 with different DB rates
Switching rate after specific yearsMulti-level method supports this automaticallyCloud restricts layer creationConfigure Year-based Phase ChangesSet ‚ÄúFrom Useful Life Year‚Äù and ‚ÄúTo Year‚Äù per phase
Declining balance applied on APCBase value defined in multi-level methodNo new base value method allowedUse Standard Base Value = APC (method 01)In depreciation key ‚Üí Base Value: standard setting
Different % in each phase (ex: Yr 1‚Äì3 = 33.33%, Yr 4‚Äì8 = 26.7%, Yr 9+ = 13.33%)Multi-level method defines each levelCloud multi-level method lockedReplicate using Phase Control + DB ratesDefine three phases with specific % for each phase
Need to maintain client-specific custom %ECC allowed any %Cloud restricts creation only in multi-level methodYou can freely maintain % inside depreciation keyEnter any % (e.g., 26.7%) directly in the key
Requirement to replicate exact ECC valuesECC multi-level methods designed for custom rulesNot possible to duplicate multi-level methodCloud-aligned method using phases produces same valuesTest using ‚ÄúDepreciation Simulation‚Äù app

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh
